GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets the search service with the given name in the given resource group.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Creates or updates a search service in the given resource group. If the search service already exists, all properties will be updated with the given values.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates an existing search service in the given resource group.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Deletes a search service in the given resource group, along with its associated resources.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Gets a list of all Search services in the given resource group.

OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Name: GetSearchServices
OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Description: Gets a list of all Search services in the given subscription.

OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Name: CheckSearchServiceNameAvailability
OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Description: Checks whether or not the given search service name is available for use. Search service names must be globally unique since they are part of the service URI (https://<name>.search.windows.net).

OtherOperations.Name: GetAdminKey
OtherOperations.Description: Gets the primary and secondary admin API keys for the specified Azure Cognitive Search service.

OtherOperations.Name: RegenerateAdminKey
OtherOperations.Description: Regenerates either the primary or secondary admin API key. You can only regenerate one key at a time.

OtherOperations.Name: CreateQueryKey
OtherOperations.Description: Generates a new query key for the specified search service. You can create up to 50 query keys per service.

OtherOperations.Name: GetQueryKeysBySearchService
OtherOperations.Description: Returns the list of query API keys for the given Azure Cognitive Search service.

OtherOperations.Name: DeleteQueryKey
OtherOperations.Description: Deletes the specified query key. Unlike admin keys, query keys are not regenerated. The process for regenerating a query key is to delete and then recreate it.

OtherOperations.Name: GetSupportedPrivateLinkResources
OtherOperations.Description: Gets a list of all supported private link resource types for the given service.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets the details of the private endpoint connection to the search service in the given resource group.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Updates a Private Endpoint connection to the search service in the given resource group.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates a Private Endpoint connection to the search service in the given resource group.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Disconnects the private endpoint connection and deletes it from the search service.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Gets a list of all private endpoint connections in the given service.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets the details of the shared private link resource managed by the search service in the given resource group.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Initiates the creation or update of a shared private link resource managed by the search service in the given resource group.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Initiates the creation or update of a shared private link resource managed by the search service in the given resource group.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Initiates the deletion of the shared private link resource from the search service.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Gets a list of all shared private link resources managed by the given service.
